message.content:
cs.CR, cs.SY, cs.SE, cs.AR, cs.PL

This paper belongs to the computer security (cs.CR) sub-category as it presents a new variant of the Spectre attack, which is a type of security vulnerability in computer processors. The paper also discusses challenges for future research on Spectre attacks and mitigations, which are typical topics in the cs.CR sub-category.

The paper also touches on system-level issues (cs.SY) such as address-space layout randomization and cache eviction, which are relevant to the design and implementation of computer systems.

The paper discusses the use of covert channels (cs.SE) to leak information from a target system, which is a common technique in the field of side-channel attacks.

The paper also discusses the use of AVX instructions (cs.AR) to improve the performance of the covert channel, which is a topic related to computer architecture.

Finally, the paper discusses the implementation of the attack using programming languages such as C and Python (cs.PL), which is relevant to the field of programming languages and compilers.
